medical_history.chief_complaint: Three day history of right lower quadrant abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain first started three days ago while she was going on a walk, leading her to go home and lie down due to severe intensity. The pain has progressed and is now sharp and non-radiating in the right lower quadrant. It is not worsened by eating, and alleviated by lying still. Accompanying symptoms include nausea, diminished appetite, and night sweats; she denies vomiting, recent gastrointestinal illness, or changes to bowel habits.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of type II diabetes mellitus (DM2), hypertension (HTN), asthma, and obesity. Patient has never had anything like this pain before and denies prior abdominal surgery or gastrointestinal diseases.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for brain aneurysms (mother and maternal uncle), coronary artery disease (CAD), and diabetes mellitus (DM).
